intro: Ptilochaeta glabra var. lanceolata, commonly known as the smooth-haired grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has slender, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth to the touch. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like inflorescences, which are usually greenish or brownish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or open woodlands. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions, though it is not widely cultivated for ornamental purposes.
